member.name: T:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU
member.summary: The "Unleashed" interface for 32-bit PRNGs: This interface enables fetching of higher-strength full-range random numbers direct from the PRNG's algorithm.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next
member.summary: Returns a non-negative 32-bit integer from the PRNG, in the range of [0, int.MaxValue)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a non-negative 32-bit integer from the PRNG, in the range of [0, maxValue)
member.param: Must be >0

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the next 32-bit integer from the PRNG, in the range of [minValue, maxValue). Can be negative.
member.param: Must be <= maxValue. Can be negative.
Must be >= minValue. Can be negative

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.NextBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fills an array of bytes with the octets of the next number(s) from the PRNG
member.param: Must NOT be null

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.NextDouble
member.summary: Returns a double precision floating-point number from the PRNG. Range is [0, 1.0)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.NextFloat
member.summary: Returns a single precision floating-point number by using 24 of the 32 bits of the next number from the PRNG. Range is [0, 1.0)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.NextU
member.summary: Returns an unsigned 32-bit integer in the range of [0, UInt32.MaxValue] inclusive at both ends ("full range")

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.NextU(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns an unsigned 32-bit integer in the range of [0, maxValue)
member.param: Must be >1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.NextU(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns an unsigned 32-bit integer in the range of [minValue, maxValue)
member.param: Must be < maxValue-1
Must be > minValue+1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next64
member.summary: Returns a signed 64-bit integer (63 bits of randomness) in the range of [0, Int64.MaxValue] inclusive at both ends ("full range")

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next64(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a signed 64-bit integer (63 bits of randomness) in the range of [0, Int64.MaxValue)
member.param: Must be >1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next64(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a signed 64-bit integer (63 bits of randomness) in the range of [minValue, maxValue), can be negative.
member.param: Must be < maxValue-1; can be negative
Must be > minValue+1; can be negative

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next64U
member.summary: Returns an unsigned 64-bit integer in the range of [0, UInt64.MaxValue] inclusive at both ends.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next64U(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns an unsigned 64-bit integer in the range of [0, maxValue)
member.param: Must be >1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.Next64U(System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Returns an unsigned 64-bit integer in the range of [minValue, maxValue)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.IRandomU.GetRandomCompatible
member.summary: Get a System.Random-compatible interface

member.name: T:Xoshiro.Base.IRandom64U
member.summary: The "Unleashed" interface for 64-bit PRNGs: This interface enables fetching of higher-strength full-range random numbers direct from the PRNG's algorithm.

member.name: P:Xoshiro.Base.IRandom64U.FoldMethod
member.summary:
Specifies how to 'fold' 64-bit numbers generated by the PRNG into 32-bit numbers.
See for an explanation of the methods

member.name: T:Xoshiro.Base.Fold64To32Method
member.summary: Methods of folding a 64-bit value into a 32-bit value

member.name: F:Xoshiro.Base.Fold64To32Method.XorMethod
member.summary: XOR the upper and lower parts of the 64-bit value into a 32-bit value

member.name: F:Xoshiro.Base.Fold64To32Method.ChunkMethod
member.summary: Returns the upper 32-bit part first, then the next iteration return the lower part

member.name: T:Xoshiro.Base.SplitMix64
member.summary: A generator to quickly generate 64- or 32-bit states for the PRNGs. DO NOT USE THIS CLASS AS A PRNG.

member.name: F:Xoshiro.Base.SplitMix64.FoldMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method used to fold 64-bit integers into 32-bit integers.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.SplitMix64.#ctor(System.Int64,Xoshiro.Base.Fold64To32Method)
member.summary: Instantiates a SplitMix64 object with a given initial state.
member.param: Initial State

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.SplitMix64.Next
member.summary: Get one UInt64 number from the SplitMix64 generator

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.SplitMix64.FillArray64(System.UInt64[])
member.summary: Fill an array of UInt64 with the next numbers from the SplitMix64 generator
member.param: Must not be null

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.SplitMix64.FillArray32(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Fill an array of UInt32 by folding the next numbers from the SplitMix64 generator
member.param: Must not be null

member.name: T:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase
member.summary: Base class of all Xoshiro/Xoroshiro PRNG Family

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.NextU
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 32-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next64U
member.summary:
Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG.
Note: This is full range of [0, UInt64.MaxValue]

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next64U(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [0, maxValue)
member.param: Must be >1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next64U(System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [minValue, maxValue)
member.param: Must be < maxValue-1
Must be > minValue+1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next64
member.summary:
Fetch the next Signed 64-bit integer from the PRNG.
Note: This is full range of [0, long.MaxValue]
WARNING: Only 63 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next64(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative Signed 64-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [0, maxValue).
WARNING: Only 63 bits of randomness!
member.param: Must be >1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next64(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Fetch a Signed 64-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [minValue, maxValue)
Note: (maxValue-minValue) must be within [0, long.MaxValue]
WARNING: Only 63 bits of randomness!
member.param: Must be < maxValue-1; can be negative
Must be > minValue+1; can be negative

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.NextU(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 32-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [0, maxValue)
member.param: Must be > 0

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.NextU(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 32-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [minValue, maxValue)
member.param: Must be < maxValue-1
Must be > minValue+1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative Signed 32-bit integer from the PRNG.
WARNING: This method will NOT return int.MaxValue, similar to System.Random.Next()

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next(System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetch a non-negative Signed 32-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [0, maxValue)
member.param: Numbers returned must be less than this. Must be >1

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.Next(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetch a Signed 32-bit integer from the PRNG, within the range [minValue, maxValue).
member.param: Must be <= maxValue. Can be negative.
Must be >= minValue. Can be negative.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.NextInt
member.summary:
Fetch a Signed 32-bit integer from the PRNG.
Note: This is full range of [int.MinValue, int.MaxValue], inclusive at both ends.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.Base.XoshiroBase.NextIntNonNegative
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative, Signed 32-bit integer from the PRNG.
Note: This is full non-negative range of [0, int.MaxValue], inclusive at both ends.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128plus
member.summary: A very fast PRNG with 128-bit state, suitable for generating random floating-point numbers.

remarks.para: Due to some apparent weaknesses of the output's lower-orded bits, it is NOT recommended to use this PRNG to generate random 64-bit integers. (Double precision floating-point numbers only use the upper 53 bits.)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128plus.#ctor
member.summary: Default (Null) Constructor with seed taken from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128plus.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructor with custom seed, which will be expanded into states by the SplitMix64 algorithm.
member.param: seed to initialize the state of SplitMix64

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128plus.#ctor(System.UInt64[])
member.summary:
Constructor with custom initial state.
WARNING: DO NOT use this constructor unless you know exactly what you're doing!
member.param: Array (minimum of 2 elements) containing the initial state

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128plus.Next64U
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128starstar
member.summary: A fast PRNG with 128-bit state, suitable for generating 64-bit random numbers (integer and floating-point).

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128starstar.#ctor
member.summary: Default (Null) Constructor with seed taken from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128starstar.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructor with custom seed, which will be expanded into states by the SplitMix64 algorithm.
member.param: seed to initialize the state of SplitMix64

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128starstar.#ctor(System.UInt64[])
member.summary:
Constructor with custom initial state.
WARNING: DO NOT use this constructor unless you know exactly what you're doing!
member.param: Array (minimum of 2 elements) containing the initial state

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoRoShiRo128starstar.Next64U
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256plus
member.summary: A fast PRNG with 256-bit state, suitable for generating random double precision floating-point numbers.

remarks.para: Due to some apparent weaknesses of the output's lower-orded bits, it is NOT recommended to use this PRNG to generate random 64-bit integers. (Double precision floating-point numbers only use the upper 53 bits.)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256plus.#ctor
member.summary: Default (Null) Constructor with seed taken from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256plus.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructor with custom seed, which will be expanded into states by the SplitMix64 algorithm.
member.param: seed to initialize the state of SplitMix64

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256plus.#ctor(System.UInt64[])
member.summary:
Constructor with custom initial state.
WARNING: DO NOT use this constructor unless you know exactly what you're doing!
member.param: Array (minimum of 4 elements) containing the initial state

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256plus.Next64U
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256starstar
member.summary: A fast PRNG with 256-bit state, suitable for generating all-purpose random numbers (64-bit integers and double precision floating-point).
member.remarks: If, however, one has to generate only 64-bit floating-point numbers (by extracting the upper 53 bits) xoshiro256+ is a slightly (â‰ˆ15%) faster generator with analogous statistical properties. For general usage, one has to consider that [the plus version's] lowest bits have low linear complexity and will fail linearity tests.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256starstar.#ctor
member.summary: Default (Null) Constructor with seed taken from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256starstar.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructor with custom seed, which will be expanded into states by the SplitMix64 algorithm.
member.param: seed to initialize the state of SplitMix64

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256starstar.#ctor(System.UInt64[])
member.summary:
Constructor with custom initial state.
WARNING: DO NOT use this constructor unless you know exactly what you're doing!
member.param: Array (minimum of 4 elements) containing the initial state

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.XoShiRo256starstar.Next64U
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base
member.summary: The base class for all PRNGs that natively output 64-bit integers.

remarks.para: You'll notice that all internal state variables are also 64 bits.

member.name: P:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.FoldMethod
member.summary: Sets the desired folding method to convert the 64-bit PRNG output to 32 bits.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.NextU
member.summary:
Fetch a folded Unsigned 32-bit integer from the PRNG.
Note: This is full range of [0, UInt32.MaxValue]
This is

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.NextBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fill an array of bytes with the next numbers from the PRNG.
member.param: Cannot be null

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.Sample
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative double precision floating-point number, within the range [0, 1.0)
WARNING: Only 53 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.NextDouble
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative double precision floating-point number, within the range [0, 1.0)
WARNING: Only 53 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.NextFloat
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative single precision floating-point number, within the range [0, 1.0)
WARNING: Only 24 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG64.Xoshiro64Base.GetRandomCompatible
member.summary:
Get a System.Random-compatible interface.
Do note that System.Random-compatible interface does not provide 64-bit values!

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128plus
member.summary: A very fast PRNG with 128-bit state, suitable for generating random single precision floating-point numbers.

remarks.para: Due to some apparent weaknesses of the output's lower-orded bits, it is NOT recommended to use this PRNG to generate random 32-bit integers. (Single precision floating-point numbers only use the upper 23 bits.)

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128plus.#ctor
member.summary: Default (Null) Constructor with seed taken from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128plus.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructor with custom seed, which will be expanded into states by the SplitMix64 algorithm.
member.param: seed to initialize the state of SplitMix64

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128plus.#ctor(System.UInt32[])
member.summary:
Constructor with custom initial state.
WARNING: DO NOT use this constructor unless you know exactly what you're doing!
member.param: Array (minimum of 4 elements) containing the initial state

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128plus.NextU
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 32-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128starstar
member.summary: A very fast PRNG with 128-bit state, suitable for generating random 32-bit integers and single precision floating-point numbers.
member.remarks: If, however, one has to generate only 32-bit floating-point numbers (by extracting the upper 23 bits) xoshiro128+ might be slightly faster, with analogous statistical properties. For general usage, one has to consider that [the plus version's] lowest bits have low linear complexity and will fail linearity tests.

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128starstar.#ctor
member.summary: Default (Null) Constructor with seed taken from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128starstar.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructor with custom seed, which will be expanded into states by the SplitMix64 algorithm.
member.param: seed to initialize the state of SplitMix64

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128starstar.#ctor(System.UInt32[])
member.summary:
Constructor with custom initial state.
WARNING: DO NOT use this constructor unless you know exactly what you're doing!
member.param: Array (minimum of 4 elements) containing the initial state

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.XoShiRo128starstar.NextU
member.summary: Fetch an Unsigned 32-bit integer from the PRNG.

member.name: T:Xoshiro.PRNG32.Xoshiro32Base
member.summary: The base class for all PRNGs that natively output 32-bit integers.

remarks.para: You'll notice that all internal state variables are also 32 bits.

member.summary: Fill an array of bytes with the next numbers from the PRNG.
member.param: Cannot be null

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.Xoshiro32Base.Sample
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative double precision floating-point number, within the range [0, 1.0)
WARNING: Only 24 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.Xoshiro32Base.NextDouble
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative double precision floating-point number, within the range [0, 1.0)
WARNING: Only 24 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.Xoshiro32Base.NextFloat
member.summary:
Fetch a non-negative single precision floating-point number, within the range [0, 1.0)
WARNING: Only 24 bits of randomness!

member.name: M:Xoshiro.PRNG32.Xoshiro32Base.Next64U
member.summary:
Fetch an Unsigned 64-bit integer by appending two consecutive 32-bit integers from the PRNG.
Note: This is full range of [0, UInt64.MaxValue]
